title: Referendum
summary: A referendum (plural: referendums or less commonly referenda) is a direct vote by the  electorate on a particular proposal or issue. This is in contrast to an issue being voted on by a representative. It can have nationwide or local forms. This may result in the adoption of a new policy or specific law. In some countries, it is synonymous with or commonly known by other names including a plebiscite, votation, popular consultation, ballot question, ballot measure, or proposition.
